attributes.action: Outlaw the choosing of Prime Ministers by unelected members of political parties
attributes.additional_details: The qualification for voting in the forthcoming election of a new Prime Minister is having paid £25 as a party membership fee.  The prohibition requested would apply to all parties.
attributes.background: The choice of a new Prime Minister between general elections should not be delegated by elected MPs to unelected and unaccountable party members as if the office was a private possession of the party in power and those who have paid it a membership fee.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

If you would like the Prime Minister to be chosen by the electorate, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/138181

If you would like the resignation of a Prime Minister to trigger a general election, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/137376

Otherwise, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like Parliament to do.
